characters: BACK IN WHAT WAS THE FORUM
THE SUN SHINING DOWN FROM A BLUE SKY

dialogues.speaker: SOME TIME LATER
dialogues.text: Golden Dragon is still drifting in the mist. Erik has his fish-lodestone and is trying the direction, but the lodes is just swinging round uselessly. After trying a few time Erik gives up and throws the lodestone away into the boat The men peer into the thick mist; they are lost. Suddenly Erik sees something ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gates of the World...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Golden Dragon silently guides between two weird islands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have passed through the Gates of  the World (he looks around at  the other) Now we are in the Unknown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Golden Dragon drifts on and the mist gets thicker. There a crash of thunder. Then a series of flashes lights up th mist around them. The Vikings are uneasy, sensing a storm brewing. Suddenly Erik points above them. The others look too. They all gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hardly daring to  breathe) So THAT is what the sun looks like!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above them hangs a luminous yellow globe, its light just  breaking through the mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to each other) The sun! It's the sun! Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in wonderment) I never though I should live to see  the sun again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings all gaze up above them in awe. Harald looks f one to the other and then tries to follow their eyelines. clearly can't see it. Magic music fills the air. Suddenly the "sun" swoops off to one side and starts swaying from side to another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should the sun do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings scream and flatten themselves against the sid of the boat, as the "sun" suddenly lurches down on them o of the sky, revealing for the first time that it is NOT t sun at all but a strange monster with a long neck that  disappears off into the mist and a glowing globe for a he and huge chomping jaws. The Vikings are, understandably,  terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the sun! It's not the sun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Dragon of the North Sea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knowingly) Ah! THAT'S why I can't see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Dragon of the North Sea rises up again, however, i jaw apparently drops off and falls to the deck, and lands Snorri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel nervously picks it up and holds it up for everyone see. It is a strand of sea-weed. The Vikings are non-plus They look back at their now jawless monster. Harald Missi picks up the sea-weed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some dragon! Ooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses it back amongst his terrifies companions. Sudde there is an incredibly loud clap of thunder and flames sh out of the mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As... unbelievably... a huge monstrous visage looms out o the mist... It is a creature from the nethermost depths o the ocean... and the incandescent globe is no more than a sprouting on the end of its nose! More fire shoots out fr its nostrils and sends all the Vikings (and even Harald  Missionary) diving for the deck. Then the monstrous head  disappears back into the mist as quickly as it came, taki its light with it... The Vikings are paralyzed with fear for one brief moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Row! ROW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all scramble for the oars in a determined hysteria.  Ivar the drummer, in his panic, has set a ridiculously fa rate and nobody can keep up with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slower! Nobody can row at that speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarsely) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's all the panic about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a panic, shouting  back over his shoulder) The Dragon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harald gives a patronizing smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children afraid of the dark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there is another roar, and flames shoot out of t mist and across the deck of Golden Dragon. One man, Ornol Fishdriver, who hasn't had much to say so far, is set on  fire. Another, Bjarni Jerusalem-Farer, who has and will h even less to say then Ornolf Fishdriver, leaps out of the way of the flames and falls over the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man over board!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorfinn starts trying to fish him out. Ivar has started panic and is beating the drum too fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slower! In... Out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his eyes showing  their whites) We're being attacked! KILL! Kill!  Kill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Sven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must KILL! Kill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no good going berserk against a  dragon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven's dad slaps him around the face. There is another ro from the monster. Erik turns to Ivar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make your mind up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the Dragon's head appears out of the mists above them once again. There is panic amongst the Vikings as so start to row faster than others. Screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep up the strike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dragon's jaws open. Flame licks out, and down the cen of the vessel. There are screams as the Vikings leap out the way. Sven goes berserk again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KILL! KILL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dragon's eyes dilate and its jaws open. The men throw themselves to the deck as if expecting more fire. But ins the creature's fangs crash into the wood of the stern of  Golden Dragon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEATH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUT UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik looks around at his terror-stricken crew. He realize this is an important moment. It is up to him to save the  situation. Suddenly an idea occurs to him, as he catches  sight of the pillow that his mother gave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep rowing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik dashes to his sea-chest under the mast and pulls out the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik! Row! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up the pillow) It saved my father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik starts to shin up the mast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven's dad is desperately holding Sven back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD it! HOLD it in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEATH TO DRAGONS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Row!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone told him we've got a dragon  eating our boat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik has reached the top of the mast and is now right up  with the incandescent globe on the end of the long stalk  that grows onto the monster's nose. He grabs hold of it a swings across onto the monster's nose. At his moment Sven breaks free of his dad and throws himself onto one of the Dragon's teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red mist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bangs his head against the monstrous denture. Sven's d looks heavenward in despair.

dialogues.speaker: HARALD MISSIONARY
dialogues.text: Who is offering his bible to the petrifies Vikings in the prow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's at time like this that you'll  find this book MOST useful, you  know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel takes the bible from him and hits him over the hea with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Row! You idiot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monster's eyes dilate wildly as they try to focus on tiny figure of Erik on its snout. Erik shoves the pillow one of the Dragon's nostrils. Snorri watches Erik  incredulously. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His father went crazy too... Used to  take forty winks in the middle of a  battle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorfinn frowns -- he has a glimmering of an idea of what Erik is doing. Erik now plunges his sword through the pil in the Dragon's nostril, and feathers immediately fly int the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... take a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dragon goes cross-eyed, trying to see what's going on its snout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on! Breathe in, you cod-brain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile the Dragon's tongue suddenly licks out around i tooth. Sven instantly slices through it with his sword. T bright blood spurts, like bursting a sausage. The Dragon  gives an agonized roar and a sharp intake of breath. The  feathers that have leaked out from the pillow are instant sucked inside and the whole pillow disappears right up th Dragon's nose. For a moment everyone holds their breath. The Dragon's ey dilate wildly. Then it wrinkles its snout. Then it starts what is unmistakably a sneeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... ah... ah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold TIGHT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... ah... ah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik leaps back across the mast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHOO!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hurricane of wind and feathers blasts out of the Dragon nostrils and hits all the Vikings at once. Everyone is  disgusted by the Dragon's breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urgh! What's it been eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the blast has already catapulted the boat into the sk and it hurtles through the clouds. leaving the Dragon of North Sea far behind. They all look up at Erik and cheer. Shot of Erik. He doesn't look too happy. Neither does Ivar the Boneless, because he too has just  noticed that they are now flying and the ocean is several thousand feet below them. Ivar screams. The other all rus to the side to look too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! Get back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately they all rush to the same side and the boat tips over with far more instability than when it is in th water. Leif and Thangbrand are catapulted down into the s We watch them descend into tiny dots and tiny unheard spl below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leif the Lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Others are almost falling out. There is renewed panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Erik is still up the mast but has been dislodged and now hanging on by his hands, dangling over the open sea.  Some of the men -- Thorfinn and Sven the Berserk amongst  them -- are hauling themselves up the almost vertical slo of the deck, trying to redress the balance. Meanwhile Kei Blacksmith is dangling by one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hold on! I can't hold on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven worms his way along the edge -- at great peril to hi and grabs Keitel's wrist just as his fingers slip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaagh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel looks up in Sven's eyes. He is totally at Sven's m What thoughts are going through his mind? How is he going betray Sven in future if he is rescued? Guilt suddenly  overwhelms him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go, Sven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not worth risking your life for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got you, Keitel Blacksmith. If  you go... I go too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your own sake... For the others...  I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat begins to right itself just as Erik finally can' hold on any more, and he plummets, straight into the ship and through the bottom up to his waist. His legs dangle. At the same moment the prow of the boat tips and suddenly they are plummeting down towards the ocean. They hit the  water with an almighty splash. Erik is thrown clear of th hull by the force of the water now cascading up through t hole he has made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First we're flying -- now we're  sinking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whisks off his helmet and starts bailing. All follow s Night falls.

dialogues.speaker: SOME TIME LATER
dialogues.text: The Vikings are still bailing out, but the water is up to their thighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are we fooling? It's hopeless!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivar flings down the helmet with which he's been bailing. The others look at each other. They are reconciled to the fact that they are going to drown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopelessly) Let's sing something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone know any good drowning songs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suggestion falls flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen! Maybe we won't get to Hy- Brasil! Maybe we won't find the Horn  Resounding... but at least we've  tried... and at least we shall have  died like men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his sword) Erik's right! We'll all meet in  Valhalla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there ANYBODY who'd like to be  christened before we go down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. A distinct lack of enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't do you any HARM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we have to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... I just immerse you in  water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lost...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship creaks and starts to go under. Erik picks his up his sword. The others follow suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let me drown, Thorfinn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water starts to pour over the sides of the boat. Erik and Thorfinn raise their swords to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Till we meet in Valhalla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all prepare to run each other through. The boat sink rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm too young! Oh Odin! Not me! Please  not me! Perhaps I'd rather drown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do WISH you'd let me convert you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Erik pauses in his attempt to kill Thorfinn and look around. The ship has sunk, but the prow and the stern pos are still sticking up out of the water, and the Vikings  themselves are only up to their chests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How deep IS the ocean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very deep... usually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The realization gradually dawns on the Vikings that they' not going to sink any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Nobody kill anybody!

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN SHINING DOWN FROM A BLUE SKY
dialogues.text: The Vikings have fallen asleep where we last saw them -- to their necks in water. Gradually the warmth of the sun  coaxes them awake -- Thorfinn is the first to look up and see the brilliant shining orb in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he panics and turns) It's the Dragon again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.. no, it isn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivar has turned and is staring at something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the sky is blue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun! That's it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivar, meanwhile, is recovering from the amazement that ha immobilized him. He taps Erik on the shoulder. Erik turns and he, too, gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn to see they are standing in the shallow wat of a natural harbor. Above nestle the white walls of a  beautiful city set in a green and pleasant land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeaaaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings wade ashore, enchanted by the paradise they s before them. All at once Thorfinn spies something. He dra his sword and they all approach with caution to find that under a weeping willow tree lies the most beautiful girl. She is raven-haired, scantily dressed and fast asleep. Th Vikings approach her with trepidation, their swords and a drawn. They glance around uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) She's got no clothes on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven kneels quietly beside the girl. She stirs. Sven free The others look around fearfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) She hasn't got any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) She MUST have a knife or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they look. She hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of place IS this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P... p... perhaps they've got weapons  we haven't even dreamed of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the girl stirs again in her sleep. The Vikings  retreat several paces and grip their weapons, and glance  around as if expecting an ambush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hack her to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what else do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about making friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with disgust) "FRIENDS"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eurrgh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with making friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't go through all the hardships  of an ocean voyage to make "friends".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can make "friends" at home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This conversation has woken the girl, Aud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings react with terror, take a step back and raise their swords and axes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspiciously) WELCOME?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course. We always welcome  friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings look at each other and at their swords. They  don't think they look that much like friends themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How d'you KNOW we're "friends"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, EVERYONE is friends here on Hy- Brasil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hy-Brasil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is THIS Hy-Brasil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings erupt into an impromptu dance of joy, hugging each other and waving their swords in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! Please! What are those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those things in your hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These? What are THESE? They're swords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aud instantly recoils with terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! NO! Put them down! PUT THEM  DOWN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings gradually cease their mock battles and turn t look at Aud with incredulity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLEASE! You don't know what you're  doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put them down! (to Erik) PLEASE make them put them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHY?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But surely you know...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wonderful blessing under which  we live here on Hy-Brasil!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The king beams. The Vikings shift uneasily. They look out place and extremely scruffy in the midst of the scantily  dressed courtiers of Hy-Brasil. Aud sits beside her fathe the King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... we don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gods decreed that if ever a sword  spills human blood upon these shores,  the whole of Hy-Brasil will sink  beneath the waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Arnulf beams rapturously at the Vikings, expecting t to be overjoyed. Instead they are horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's terrible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean if just ONE PERSON gets  killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! (he thinks: isn't it  wonderful?) The Vikings look at each other,  feeling they haven't quite understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean... you can't kill ANYBODY?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right! Isn't it wonderful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings are non-plussed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Not being able to kill anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bemused) Well, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interested) How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining the obvious) Well... for a start... er... there's  no killing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, OBVIOUSLY there's no killing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... isn't it great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how d'you take revenge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (guiltily) How do you punish people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you DEFEND yourselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting a little  irritated) We don't have to. We're all terribly  nice to each other. Aren't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aud catches Erik's eye and gives him a dangerously slow w A pause of disbelief from the Vikings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course! We HAVE to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and conducts the courtiers, who chant in unison:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Being nice to each other is what  it's all about."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising as if to sing) You see? We're terribly nice to each  other We're friendly bold and free.  We never say anything nasty 'Cause  we dare not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost singing) No sirreeeee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hold the note while King Arnulf looks anxiously at t Vikings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like us to sing to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very kind of you, but we're  in rather a hurry... We're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Arnulf claps and the court stop singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, don't you WANT to  hear our singing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... well, yes, of course; it's  just we're looking for the Horn  Resounding and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think our singing's going  to be good enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no no no! It's just the Horn  Resounding is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people like our singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it's lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't want to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing tack) No... no... (he looks at the others) We'd love to hear it. Wouldn't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you'll have to ask us REALLY  nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing he has to  be diplomatic) Er... well... we... we... would be  TERRIBLY grateful if you... all...  would sing for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just saying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, of course he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They restrain Sven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course we're not; we'd genuinely  like to hear you sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REALLY?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're not just saying it because  you think we want you to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (he bites the lie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right! Summon the musicians! We'll  do the one that goes "TUM-TUM-TUM- TUM-TI-TUM-TUM"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REALLY?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetically to  Vikings) It isn't the one we're BEST at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't we do the one that goes "TI- TUM-TI-TUM-TI-TUM"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the court look hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Not when we've got guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the one that goes "TI-TUM- TI-TUM-TI-TUM-TI-TI-TUM"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a stupid suggestion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry! I just thought they might  like to hear something that we can  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! At least we know that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows the "TUM-TUM-TUM-TUM-TI- TUM-TUM" one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Right!  I agree!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too difficult!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. We'll do the one that  goes "TI-TUM-TI-TUM-TI-TUM-TI-TI- TUM". Ah! The musicians!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The musicians are huge, unshaven, have broken noses and  tattoos, and are covered in black oil -- like mechanics.  Their instruments are like heavy industrial machinery, pu in large vats of black oil that drip all over the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... Oh dear... (he glances across at  the Vikings) I'm sure you're not going to like  this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik and the others smile reassuringly. There is a lot of coughing. The King raises his baton and then brings it down, humming to himself as he does so. Th is a most awful din; caterwauling, crashing and banging,  whining, screaming... The Vikings look at each other, trying to pick out some t but it's impossible. Ivar the Boneless can't stop himself bursting out into giggles and this eventually spreads to other Vikings. King Arnulf notices and bangs the throne f silence. Gradually the din stops. King Arnulf sinks down in despai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tragically) We're just not a very musical  nation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... It was very... er, nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I want you to be ABSOLUTELY,  totally, genuinely honest with me.  Did you really, truly, honestly like  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik thinks for some moments and then decides to make a c breast of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (goes hysterically) They didn't like it! Oh God! I want  to die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole court looks as if it's about to commit mass HAR KIRI, while the musicians look rather dangerous. Erik tak the moment to get down to business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Majesty! We come from a world  where there IS no music. Where men  live and die by the axe and by the  sword...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how d'you think I feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gods are asleep, King Arnulf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU try to be nice to people, when  they're rude about your singing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik feels he is making a mess of all this diplomacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must find the Horn Resounding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King glares at Erik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it HERE in Hy-Brasil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Arnulf thinks for a moment and then speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Arnulf hesitates -- he bites his lip and then takes plunge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do the one that goes "TUM-TUM- TUM-TUM-TI-TUM-TUM". Perhaps you'll  like that better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik gives up. A lot of throat clearing. Aud, the King's  daughter, gives Erik another dangerously slow wink. The  terrible "music" starts up, shattering the calm of the  beautiful city.

dialogues.speaker: THE GOLDEN DRAGON
dialogues.text: Now afloat once more, riding at anchor in the bay. Ivar i standing on guard in it. Suddenly he sees something that  makes him gabe in horror. We don't find out what it is,  however, because we immediately

dialogues.speaker: ERIK
dialogues.text: He is deeply in love. He is also in bed with the King's n daughter, Aud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever felt like this about  anyone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... you mean "got into bed with"  them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of course not, silly -- I mean  FELT like this about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean... you HAVE got into bed  with somebody else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean have you ever felt that  for the first time in your life you'd  met somebody you could believe in  with your whole heart... someone  whose goals suddenly seem to be YOUR  goals... whose dreams seem to be  YOUR dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAVE you ever been to bed with anyone  else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that matter? But you've...  you've... FELT like this before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was different...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just for a moment it  is Helga speaking) What was she like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... oh, I didn't know her very  well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you LOVED her all the same...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never went to bed together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you go on about that? What  does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been to bed with somebody  else, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never LOVED anybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been to bed with anybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there is a banging on he door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up! I know you're in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! It's my father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up! I know you're in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the note from Ivar's horn rings out across from bay. Erik rushes to the window and looks out to see what  Ivar saw previously: a black ship approaching on the hori

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no! Halfdan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is more banging on the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aud! You've got someone in there  again, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik gives her a sharp look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick! Throw this over you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws a shabby bit of cloth over Erik and at that mo the door bursts open, and King Arnulf enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right! Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, Father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Who? Whoever you've got in here  of course!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There IS no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King starts prowling round the chamber. Erik stands t naked and petrified, with the cloak hanging over his head just where it landed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can SMELL one of those strangers...  That's who it is, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aud keeps mum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the fifth one this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he can stop himself, Erik blurts out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aud motions him to be quiet, but it's too late. The King  spins round to see who she is signaling to. The King appe to be looking straight at Erik. Erik can hardly bear the  suspense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nobody here, Father. Look  for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Arnulf looks around the chamber carefully. He looks  straight through Erik as if he weren't there. Suddenly th King strides over to Erik and Erik instinctively cowers o of the way. The King walks straight over to a very small  cupboard no more than a foot high, flings the door of it  open, and starts throwing clothes around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't be a midget, Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King turns on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! So you admit there IS someone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're losing your temper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (becoming instantly  pleasant) Of course I'm not. I never lose my  temper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivar's horn sounds again. A shadow passes over King Arnul face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear... more visitors!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strides to the window and sees Halfdan's ship. As he d so, Erik has to leap out of the way, inadvertently knocki a chest. The King spins round and addresses the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come out... come out like a man... I  know you're in there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Arnulf flings the chest open, revealing nothing but  clothes. He is baffled. He reluctantly starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) It's all in your own mind, Father...  It's YOU who imagine that I'm always  up here with some man or other....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you do it, Aud... I  sometimes think you've got some of  your mother's magic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly spies a small trinket-box and looks in that. he doesn't find any strange man in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no magic, Father... My mother  had no magic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did, I tell you! She could blind  me as easily as the night the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your fantasy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But one day I'll catch you... Like I  caught her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves. Aud closes the door. Erik throws the cloak off and starts getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cloak Invisible. It was my  mother's parting gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The fifth one this week"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for goodness' sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thought you said it was  something special...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aud runs to his side and puts her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just what I was trying to  tell you. You ARE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five this week; how many the week  before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're as bad as my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the week before that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik...! (she is really sincere) I want to help you get to Asgaard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik is torn. He doesn't know whether to believe her or n Ivar's horn sounds for a third time. Erik races to the wi He looks out. Halfdan's ship is even closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We mustn't let him land!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfdan the Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Erik...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Erik is off out of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Wait! My father will be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a thump and a yell as Erik is set upon by the Ki two musicians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might have known it was you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pinning Erik's arms  behind him) I'm not hurting you, am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You WILL tell us if we hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to march Erik through the palace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik struggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to musicians) Careful! (to Erik) They're not supposed to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! We can hold onto you -- just  so long we don't squeeze too hard or  bump you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance we hear the horn again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfdan the Black's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have reached a cell. The musicians starts to chain E up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all part of our safety  regulations. You see if someone were  to get hurt they might get angry and  then... well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be more than "hurt" if Halfdan  the Black lands! Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh! I'm terribly sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is Halfdan the Black?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to stop us waking the  Gods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's how he makes his money,  by war and plunder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to kill US!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not when we explain about the Great  Blessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know Halfdan the Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that the Great Blessing has  kept the peace for a thousand years,  and will keep it for the next  thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horn sounds again. Erik is about to argue this point  when Thorfinn suddenly bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not hurting him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Erik) Are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfdan the Black's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the King) He wants to KILL us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look at King Arnulf. The King thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want him to kill us ON Hy- Brasil! Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King thinks some more. The horn sounds once more.

dialogues.speaker: THE GOLDEN DRAGON
dialogues.text: Erik and the Vikings are scrambling into their war gear.  They glance nervously over to where Halfdan the Black's s is riding on the waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik looks at Thorfinn, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his throat dry) Sort of wobbly and excited?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Thorfinn doesn't know the meaning  of fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it sort of... like a sinking  feeling in your stomach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But. You're not even afraid of DEATH,  Thorfinn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What "magic"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard stories of a magic that  strikes fear into the heart so you  cannot fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadly serious) Yes... I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eagerly) I always feel like this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Halfdan's ship rises up out of the water, and  revealing the secret of its hidden power. Under the water line is another line of oars! The Vikings are dumbfounded Ivar drops trembling to his knees. The rest go white. Tho draws his sword. Erik realizes his men are rapidly talkin themselves into a blue funk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not magic! It's just a trick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on him angrily) Don't you FEEL it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik looks around at his paralyzed crew. He realizes he i the only one who can save the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well! It they're using magic --  we'll use magic of our own!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaps out of Golden Dragon and races up to the shore  towards the city of Hy-Brasil. Erik races into the Forum and gazes up at the high walls the Palace. Without a thought he produces two daggers and plunges them into the stonework. Then he hauls himself up the sheer cliff of wall up to Aud's bedchamber fist over  fist. It is, indeed, a prodigious feat. He arrives at Aud window exhausted. Aud, who has appeared at the window, lo at him curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you come up by the stairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik looks around and notices for the first time the  magnificent flights of stairs leading up to the top of Au tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rather miffed) Just give me a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you could have killed  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik clambers into Aud's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the Cloak Invisible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik looks around and is suddenly suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see it! (indignation suddenly  seizes him) Have you got another man in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik starts feeling the air as if expecting to find an  invisible body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik races over and grabs the cloak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bring it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik. You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's YOU who doesn't understand,  Aud. Halfdan has come to kill and  destroy. We brought him here. We  must stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at the cloak) But you don't realize....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Aud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik leaps out of the window. For a moment Aud is surpris and then alarmed as she realizes he's jumped out of the  window, which is some forty feet off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes to the window in time to see Erik parachuting  down, holding the four corners of the cloak. Erik lands s and waves with the cloak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thanks for the Cloak Invisible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! WAIT! ERIK! The Cloak! The Cloak  Invisible! It only seems to work on  my father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Erik cannot hear her. He is already racing back to hi ship.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE GOLDEN DRAGON
dialogues.text: Thorfinn is taking "Being Scared" lessons from Ivar the  Boneless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a sort of slightly sick feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! AND you keep wanting to  go to the lavatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes! I hadn't noticed that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shut up, you two. You're making  us ALL nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik leaps into Golden Dragon brandishing the Cloak Invis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Halfdan the Black's using magic,  is he? Well, I have a magic to match  his! (he holds up the Cloak  Invisible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A magic dishcloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the oars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'you think I've got time to go behind  that bush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivar starts to drum and the Vikings begin to row. Golden  Dragon heads out of the harbor.

dialogues.speaker: HALFDAN THE BLACK
dialogues.text: flanked by his advisers, Gisli Oddsson and Eilif the Mong He gives a nod and Eilif bangs his staff of office on the deck, as a signal for the galley slaves to speed up. Down the galley, the slave master (a diminutive Japanese) stal down the decks lashing the sweat-streaked galley slaves a cursing them in incomprehensive Japanese. Fortunately (or perhaps unfortunately) a translation appe in subtitles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Row! You incomprehensible, horizontal- eyed, Western trouser-wearers! Eurgh!  You all look the same to me! How I  despise your lack of subtlety and  your joined-up writing! You, who  have never committed ritual suicide  in your lives!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to his  neighbor) You know, I don't think it would be  so bad, if we knew what he was  saying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE! Unceremonious rice-pudding  eaters! How I abominate your milk- drinking and your lack of ancestor- worship and your failure to eat your  lunch out of little boxes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile the Vikings are growing increasingly uneasy as  they row towards Halfdan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What "magic" have you brought, Erik?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point, back on the Black Ship, Halfdan gives anot nod and Eilif raps out yet another command with his staff This time the prow of the Black Ship opens up like a pair jaws. The Vikings see it and panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes... (he has too!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfdan nods again and another order is rapped out. This  time a harpoon is fired from the prow. It thuds into GOLD DRAGON and two of Halfdan's dog-soldiers start to winch t line in. The two ships are hauled closer and closer. The Vikings panic even more. Erik holds up the Cloak Invi and grins round at his men, knowing he is going to surpri them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here! Here is the magic from the  King's daughter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik's men watch, half skeptical and half hopeful. Erik e the moment of suspense. The he throws the Cloak Invisible over his head and shoulders and grins round at his men  triumphantly, imagining he has vanished from their sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! I have become the wind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings look at him, rather puzzled. Only Harald seem to be impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanish into thin air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, where is he then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harald looks around. He is the only one who can't see Eri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's THERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point Halfdan's ship suddenly bites into the side Golden Dragon. Erik leaps onto the side of Golden Dragon swings across onto Halfdan's ship. The Vikings react to t horror of Halfdan's ship biting into Golden Dragon and to Erik's blithe leap onto the enemy boat. Erik lands on the deck of Halfdan's ship, and grins at the ferocious skull- helmeted dog-soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh! Scary! Scary! Don't we look  mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dog-soldiers look at each other, totally non-plussed. Erik grimaces at Halfdan's men, and does a little pirouet to show them all that he's invisible from every angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't see me! But I can see you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks into a little dance. Halfdan glares at his advi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Erik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why isn't he scared of us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik, meanwhile approaches one of the dog-soldiers and ma silly faces at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog-soldier topples overboard. The galley slaves watc another dog-soldier fall into the hold amongst them and l there stunned. His sword falls onto the deck between the  slaves. One of the slaves throws down his oar, and picks the dog-soldier's sword. The slave-master suddenly appear Once again he speaks immaculate Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Hey! What's going on? Your big- breasted women give me no pleasure  with their warmed-up fish and...  Urgh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slave-master strides down the ship to flay the offend slave, but another slave trips him up and in a twinkling an eye four others have leapt on the slave-master (despit their chains) and are extracting his keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? Haven't you seen  anyone fight before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're usually too scared of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KILL him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik, still thinking he's invisible, is running amongst t dog-soldiers, having fun. He runs one dog-soldier through and kicks another overboard, then he runs past a few more right up to Halfdan himself. He whisks the Cloak Invisibl off his head for an instant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking he's  revealing himself) Here I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he turns and is off. Halfdan turns to his aides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE GOLDEN DRAGON
dialogues.text: The Vikings' disbelief has turned to admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! THAT'S a true Berserk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just building up to it, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven starts banging his head on the side of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone batty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! The fear's gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfdan grabs a sword off one of his dead dog-soldiers an thrusts it into the unwilling hands of his military advis Eilif.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight, damn you! Fight!

dialogues.speaker: THE GOLDEN DRAGON
dialogues.text: Now Sven leaps across onto Halfdan's ship followed by Iva yelling. Snorri looks back at Keitel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel is thinking: "Maybe I should let Halfdan win" but knows he can't let a thing like that happen, now he is fa with the reality of it. The companionship of the voyage h brought them all too close for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Hang the Blacksmith's Code!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel leaps to his feet and joins in the attack. Erik,  meanwhile, is swinging across the deck from a rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the air! I am the wind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel and Thorfinn are now fighting side by side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is life, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel grins and strikes out. Ivar turns on Eilif who has reluctantly joined the fray. Maybe he's singled Ivar out the most harmless. Ivar suddenly realizes he's only armed with drumsticks. Eilif smiles evilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh... er...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eilif's sword slices through Ivar's drumsticks. Ivar turn to run, but is stopped by a dog-soldier. Eilif takes the  opportunity to run him through from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he dies) Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik sees Ivar's demise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ivar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik leaps to take revenge. He jumps into the galley-pit out again a la Douglas Fairbanks in "The Thief of Baghdad and dispatches Eilif with a single thrust. Sven and his d are fighting surrounded by dog-soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, go on! Go berserk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIVE US A CHANCE, Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snorri appears from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sven's dad) What about you? Why don't YOU go  berserk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to keep my eye on HIM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven's dad looks uneasy. He is surrounded and, as a seaso campaigner, knows they haven't much chance. Halfdan smile to himself. The battle is going his way. Thorfinn meanwhi is fighting two dog-soldiers but is attacked from behind a third.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! Thorfinn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's too late. Thorfinn is run through the back. Sven goes berserk and kills all three dog-soldiers. Sven's dad looks on, proud of his son for the first time. Maybe thei relationship will never be the same again. Now Snorri sees something that cheers him up. Slaves are  coming up from below to join the battle. They are armed w oars and swords. They join the fray, knocking dog-soldier overboard with their oars. The dog-soldier are suddenly  outnumbered. Halfdan's smile fades, and he looks around f an escape route. The tide of battle has now turned  dramatically as dog-soldier after dog-soldier is tossed o the side or laid low by the combination of Vikings and sl Halfdan and Gisli slip into a lifeboat and sneak off. The rats are leaving the sinking ship.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE DECK
dialogues.text: All the dog-soldiers are dead or overboard. The slaves an Vikings are cheering and embracing each other. At the oth end of the boat, Sven is cradling the dying Thorfinn in h arms. All around are jubilant slaves celebrating their  freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorfinn! You can't die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not frightened... of anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll see my grandfather in Valhalla!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dying) No... he's not... not... there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I'm coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorfinn dies. Sven holds him and a tear comes down his f The danger has made comrades of the two rivals. Erik, however, is still fighting a last lone dog-soldier; but just as he is about to run him through the dog-soldie is stabbed in the back. He sinks to the floor, revealing  another dog-soldier. Erik is outraged by this act of trea and turns on the assassin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! Wait! Please wait, Erik!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog-soldier pulls his mask off to reveal he is, in fa Loki. Erik is totally non-plussed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOKI! Where did YOU come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfdan wanted to stop you waking  the Gods... so... I disguised myself  to sabotage their plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik has meanwhile been joined by the remaining comrades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To save YOU, Erik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik is about to say "But how can you see me? I'm wearing the Cloak Invisible."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my master Keitel's idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes turn on Keitel who looks very uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't it, Keitel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I... I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel is overcome by the power of Loki's will, but he is deeply ashamed of his complicity in Loki's deeds. Snorri  gazes at Keitel with growing suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... How is it you can see me? (he looks round) You can all see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What d'you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why shouldn't we see you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm wearing the Cloak Invisible....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik takes it off to demonstrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! There you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others) You mean... you could see me all the  time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings look at each other, mystified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weren't we supposed to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I feel a little... oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik's knees give way and he faints onto the deck.

dialogues.speaker: KING'S HALL
dialogues.text: A victory celebration is in progress. It is a little bit  like a Hampstead cocktail party, and the rough, battle-st Vikings look rather out of place holding their little can Suddenly the King claps for silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are grateful to you, Erik, and to  your men...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there is only ONE way we can  repay you... Musicians!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Arnulf claps his hands. Erik rushes over to him, anx to avoid another Hy-Brasilian concert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurriedly) Well, we'd love to hear you sing  again, but what we'd really appreciate  would be if you could see your way  to lending... not giving of course...  but just lending us the... um...  the, well, to be quite blunt... the  Horn Resounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time Erik is talking the doors of the hall behind are opening and a vast lur or horn is carried in by six  bearers. One or two of the Vikings have turned to look an are now standing speechless. King Arnulf beams at Erik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Erik finally turns and looks at what everyone else is looking at. Erik's jaw drops. Everyone in the court beams Erik, except Aud who is looking sad and disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (when he can find his  voice) Is THAT it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cloud passes over King Arnulf's happy face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something the matter with  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! No! No... of course not... it's  just I hadn't expected it to be quite  so big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not called the Horn  Resounding for nothing. (aside) You DO know how to play the horn,  don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... oh, yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I expect you'll be leaving first  thing in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King manhandles Erik away from his daughter. Perhaps have the feeling that she's isn't going to let Erik go as easily as that... Mix through to later that night. The Vi are lying asleep on the Great Hall, beside the Horn  Resounding. The camera closes in on Keitel. Suddenly a vo comes from the shadows:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Keitel! Keitel Blacksmith!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel opens his eyes and finds Loki close beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Keitel Blacksmith?  Have you forgotten why you came on  this voyage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to let Erik wake the  Gods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can we stops him now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loki looks around and then opens his hand in front of Kei In it is the mouthpiece from the Horn Resounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this and throw it from the cliff  heights. They'll never make the Horn  Resounding sound without it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel frowns. Then an obvious thought limps across his  muscular mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why me? Why don't you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh! Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be able to throw it further  than I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel thinks. This is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must go far out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loki presses the mouthpiece on Keitel. Keitel takes it, b reluctantly. Another Viking stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely you haven't forgotten the  Blacksmith's Oath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel is about to reply and say he's been having second  thoughts about it, but somehow he can't. Loki has such po over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly another Viking stirs, and Loki hisses at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loki pretend to go back to sleep. Keitel (feeling a bit  lumbered) thinks about his task and hesitates... Who know Perhaps he is about to stand firm, but Loki plays his tru card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without opening his  eyes) Or I might have to tell Erik why you  really came on this voyage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel is caught. He closes his eyes in resignation and t reluctantly starts to make his way out of the Hall. As he gets to the doors he trips over Snorri, who wakes. The  mouthpiece falls a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. I'm just going to water the  dragon... (he gives a false  laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snorri notices the silver mouthpiece on the floor, but he pretends he hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... clumsy idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snorri pretends to go back to sleep, but he opens one eye and watches Keitel Blacksmith recover the mouthpiece, and then follows Keitel out. Loki gets up too. He follows to  keep an eye on Snorri.

dialogues.speaker: AUD ON THE SHORE
dialogues.text: Gazing moodily out to sea. She is brooding in Erik's immi departure. Suddenly a stone falls from above; she looks u and sees a figure appear on the cliff above. Hurriedly sh withdraws into the shadows. Keitel Blacksmith appears on cliff-top. In his hands he holds the mouthpiece of the Ho Resounding. He examines it, turning over in his mind whet he is doing the right thing or not. Then he decides he mu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) My fellow blacksmiths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He prepares to throw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel jumps out of his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Keitel Blacksmith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away, Snorri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you got there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snorri advances towards Keitel. Keitel backs away, danger near to the edge of the cliff. His boot slips and he jerk himself forward. At the same time Snorri makes a grab for the mouthpiece. A scuffle ensues, during which the mouthp of the Horn Resounding is dropped. It bounces off the cli and falls down to the shore below. Aud steps out of the s and picks it up. She frowns and looks up, and then scream as she sees the men fighting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's too late. Snorri goes white, gives a hideous gas and sinks slowly to his knees -- revealing Loki standing  behind him with a bloody knife. As Keitel and Loki watch  Snorri die, a drop of blood from the knife falls to the  ground. The moment it lands, there is a deep subterranean groan, and the earth begins to tremble violently. Keitel Loki look around in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Gods! What have we done?

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE KING'S HALL
dialogues.text: Sven, Sven's dad and Harald are wide awake, but for the m paralyzed, as bits of masonry crash around them. The chee figure of King Arnulf appears at the top of a stairway. H raises his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay calm! This is NOT happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King then hurries out of a door at the top of the  staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors of the Great Hall burst open and a wall of wate crashes through, knocking the Vikings off their feet. The is little doubt that the whole of Hy-Brasil is sinking se street go down, a statue sink and then we:

dialogues.speaker: KING ARNULF
dialogues.text: He is standing at the top of the Forum steps addressing a crowd of anxious citizens. They are keeping surprisingly  good order considering they are already standing ankle-de in water, and the whole town is rapidly sinking around th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I know what some of you must be  thinking... the day has come....  we're all going down, etc. etc. But  let's get away from the fantasy and  look at the FACTS. FACT ONE -- The  threat of total destruction has kept  the peace for one thousand years.  FACT TWO -- The chances of it failing  now are therefore one in three hundred  and sixty-five thousand. FACT THREE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By this time the water is up to people's knees, and sever have crowded onto the lower steps to avoid getting wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FACT THREE -- Our safety regulations  are the most rigorous in the world.  We are all nice to each other, we  never rub each other up the wrong  way or contradict each other, do we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumble. The buildings sink and masonry falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We... er... do seem to be going down  quite fast, Your Majesty -- not trying  to contradict you, course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of course you're not, citizen.  But let's stick to the facts. There  has NEVER been a safer, more certain  way of keeping the peace. So  whatever's happening, you can rest  assured, Hy-Brasil is NOT sinking.  Repeat, NOT sinking.

dialogues.speaker: AN UNFORTUNATE HY-BRASILIAN
dialogues.text: Who looks out of a window to see if it's raining, but is  immersed before he can find out. The citizens in the Forum, however, are reassured by the  King's words -- even though they are now up to their wais in water. One of them steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I just make a point in support  of what King Arnulf's just said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd be delighted -- wouldn't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we'd certainly like to hear  what one of us has got to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik, Sven, Sven's dad and Harald struggle out of the Gre Hall, carrying their belongings and the Horn Resounding,  while the citizen is still speaking most articulately in  support of the King. They are ALMOST in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you all doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) It's all right. It's not happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently) The place is sinking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I thought it was too, but the  King's just pointed out that it can't  be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still speaking in  support of the King) ...and, of course, we mustn't forget  King Arnulf's EXCELLENT eye for flower- arranging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a smattering of applause. A few people pull thei robes up out of the wet. Erik leaps onto a wall and shout to the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save yourselves! Hy-Brasil... is  sinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are a lot of knowing smiles amongst the citizens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you don't know our safety  regulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it IS! Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Erik) The important thing is not to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite... yes... we understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already appointed the Chancellor  as Chairman of a committee to find  out exactly what IS going on, and  meantime I suggest we have a sing- song!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we do the one that goes "TUM-TI- TUM-TI-TUM-TI-TUM"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik looks around in despair. Meanwhile in another street someone is struggling in the  floodwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't swim! I can't swim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm drowning! Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loki grabs Keitel round the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Keitel is pulled under. He re-emerges spluttering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urrgh! Argh! Let go, you idiot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll drown us bo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they go under again. At this point Erik, Sven, Sven's dad and Harald swim round the corner, pushing the Horn  Resounding. They see the figures disappearing under the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik, Sven and Co. swim as fast as they can to rescue the drowning pair. They struggle to overpower the panic-stric Loki, but he puts up a manic fight. Unexpectedly, Harald  Missionary suddenly unleashes a vicious right hook and la Loki out cold. There is a moment's stunned silence that i no unmingled with indignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with hurt surprise) You hit him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's what you're supposed to  do... isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up as Golden Dragon sails around a corner of th street, piloted by Aud. As the Vikings scramble aboard, t sound of the "sing-song" reaches a particularly noisy and discordant climax attract their attention.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN WHAT WAS THE FORUM
dialogues.text: A crowd of unconcerned-looking citizens is sitting on the last roof and just coming to the end of another appalling song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Te... Tum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I think we're getting  better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with genuine interest) How can you tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit stumped) Er...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right! It isn't happening!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Father, it IS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on board!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No THANKS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think YOU are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panic-monger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof is now sinking rapidly, though the citizens appe as unperturbed as ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Leave 'em alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sinking! Hy-Brasil is sinking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
