dialogues.text: Well, my dear, I think you'll find  it's all a question of what you want  to believe in.... I have slightly  more experience of these matters  than you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, at this point, the entire gathering of  citizens, the King and the Forum Temple disappear below t waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father! (tears spring to her  eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harald Missionary has put his arm around Aud in a fatherl way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, my child... it's at times  like this that this book can be a  great help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik shoos him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with his usual  promptness) Right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDEN DRAGON spins alone in the wide ocean.

dialogues.speaker: SOME TIME LATER
dialogues.text: They are all gathered in front of the Horn Resounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) We must blow the first note... he  note that will take us to Asgaard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously and with  awe in his voice) Over the Edge of the World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other men look up at the Horn Resounding, and begin t feel a bit nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going where only the dead  have been before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik takes a deep breath and then puts his lips to the Ho Resounding. He blows. There is a splutter, and one or two the Vikings titter amongst themselves. He has another go. But again, all he produces is a pathetic spluttering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not unkindly in his  manner) Uh! Here! Give it to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven pushes Erik aside. Sven blow... he becomes redder an redder. But all he produces is a splutter. He gets a bit  angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thor's blood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven's dad looks heavenwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not using the right technique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven's dad tries to take it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'm doing it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting angry) You're always telling me... TELLING  me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik tries to separate them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his dad) Let me do something for myself for a  change!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Aud comes forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Don't quarrel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven and his dad stop fighting, surprised by the vehement her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never get where we want to go  if we fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aud crosses to the Horn and inserts the mouthpiece. Loki  glances at Keitel. He hadn't bargained for this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Er... don't blow it! You never know  WHAT might happen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has not spoken for a thousand  years... You must bring it to life  with a kiss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her lips to the mouthpiece and just touches it w them... almost a kiss... then... very gently... she begin to blow... a soft... slight note can just be heard... Aud takes her mouth away from the mouthpiece... and the soft  note goes on... reverberating... A sweet note... a magic  note... the Vikings stand stock-still, enchanted by the  sound... and the sound all the time is getting louder and the Horn begins to vibrate with the note. As the volume  increases the Golden Dragon itself begins to reverberate  with the sound. Rings of ripples begin to radiate out fro the boat across the calm water. The note grows louder and louder, and the Vikings, who at first were laughing and  cheering at Aud's success, begin to get rather alarmed. L and louder gets the note and the Horn shakes and the boat vibrates. Things start to be shaken loose, and fall onto deck. Ropes uncoil and run loose. A heavy block suddenly  crashes down to the deck, crowning Harald and laying him flat. Louder and louder grows the note, and the Vikings h to stop their ears for the pain. The water around the shi becomes more and more agitated. And then another sound is heard. It is the thunder of water in the distance like a  million distant waterfalls. And suddenly they notice the is running like a river -- all in one direction... sweepi the ship forward with incredible momentum. In no time the are engulfed in a mist, still traveling at a rate of knot Almost at once an appointed rock looms out of the mist ah of them. Erik flings himself at the steering oar, and eve is thrown about as the ship veers wildly and just misses rock, only to see another looming up ahead of them. The s veers again, as a third rock looms ahead. This time Sven grabbed a coil of rope, and as they pass the third rock, throws it like a lasso over the rock. Loki and Keitel lea to grab the rope just as the rope goes taut and the ship  comes to a lurching stop, anchored by the rope, but still swaying and buffeted in the racing waters. Those on board shout to each other, soaked to the skin. It is difficult make out what they are shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What d'you think? Help! Somebody  help us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at Aud) She wants to kill us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to take us over the Edge  of the World!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to get to Asgaard, don't  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we know this is the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) We blew the Horn Resounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming and pointing  an accusing finger  at Aud) SHE blew the Horn Resounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Don't you see, Erik! She wants  revenge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Keitel) Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows it was our fault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your mouth shut, Keitel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! It's YOU, Loki! I should never  have listened to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loki looks around desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've lost your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came to stop you waking the Gods,  Erik! But I didn't want anyone to  get hurt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Loki produces his stiletto and leaps onto Keitel stabbing at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have got rid of you long  ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you got rid of Snorri!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik tries to separate them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! We are in the spell of the  Horn! Hatred will destroy us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a split second Erik is distracted. He looks across at Aud and for a moment he sees Freya standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you are in the spell of the  Horn, hatred will destroy you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it is Aud once more. But in that split second Loki h stabbed Erik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrgh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik staggers back clutching his arm. Keitel gives a roar rage, and picks Loki up bodily and hurls him out of the b into the maelstrom. The other Vikings look on aghast. Kei turns on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed Snorri! He caused the land  of Hy-Brasil to sink! SHE knew!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she wants to send us over the  Edge of the World!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How else d'you think we're going to  get to Asgaard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings look at each other amidst the roaring waters the thick spray. Erik holds his bleeding arm and looks at Aud. Should he trust her or not? Suddenly he turns on the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting above the  din) Do YOU know the way to Asgaard, Keitel  Blacksmith?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do YOU know the way to Asgaard, Sven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one road before us, and  that leads over the Edge of the World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harald sits up as he returns to consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There IS no Edge of the World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven's dad bonks him again. Erik takes the rope and begin paying it out. With grim faces the Vikings turn and face  towards the roaring of the waters, as Erik edge the ship  further into the mist. The noise is deafening. It would b almost impossible to hear any voice above it. The faces of the Vikings betray their fear as they find  themselves emerging from out of the mist at the Edge of t World. They gape as they find themselves confronted by a  Waterfall of Seas -- stretching on either side of them -- far as the eye can see -- water falling and plunging over the lip of the world. And in front of them -- the blue sk continues on down and down until it shades into blackness strewn with stars beneath their feet... Sven, Sven's dad and Keitel edge to the prow and gasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Don't look over the Edge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik lets out a little more rope, until the ship is protr over the edge. Sven, his dad and Keitel peer over the sid and stare down into the abyss. They gasp. From above we s the prow of Golden Dragon and the backs of the Vikings' h in plain view against a backdrop of stars below them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aud holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Don't look... The abyss will  suck away your strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I MUST look! Keitel! Hold this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik turns to see Sven and Keitel trembling... They hold  onto the sides of the ship but their legs can barely supp them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing we can do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helpless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel start to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha... I believed Loki... I believed  I had a duty to blacksmiths! Ha ha  ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel laughs a little hysterically. Aud turns urgently t Erik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU still want to go to Asgaard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe I love you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... but I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to love me. Just: do  you believe I love YOU?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- I believe you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik hesitates, then he decides to believe in Aud. He thr the rope away. At once the ship shoots off over the Edge the World into space... Everything seems to slow down, as the longship drops down and down... the ship twists slowl as it drops.... round and round. The Vikings gaze about t in wonder, as they find their ship if falling in silence  amongst the stars. Harald comes to once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still seeing stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keitel looks round at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ALL seeing stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I was hit on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The longship falls and falls through the star-strewn spac until it softly lands in a white wilderness. On the deck the Vikings are huddles up, covered with rime frost. It seems as if they have been lying there half-fro for some time. Perhaps the entire adventure has all been a dream, and th have been stuck in the Arctic pack-ice the whole time. Th hallucinations of men near to death. Aud tries to wake Erik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sleep... wake... Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik opens his eyes and, for an instant, he sees Helga. H blinks and realizes it is Aud who is calling him back to  consciousness. Suddenly colored lights begin to play to h face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bi-Frost... The Rainbow Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above them the Aurora Borealis stretches up, magnificent awesome in the sky. Erik makes his way through the other  Vikings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others slowly begin to rouse themselves from their ic slumber and sit up, awed by the sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Are we dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rainbow Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all peer up at the ever-changing colors of the Auror Borealis, hanging in the sky above them like organ-pipes. But something is happening. The lights begin to fade to r a magical city on a mountain. The Vikings realize that th is journey's end... they have reached Asgaard... the City the Gods. The Vikings all catch their breaths and gaze in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asgaard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there, you fathead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up WHERE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harald look round quizzically at the others. It is clear  that he can see nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! It's real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harald looks around at the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallucinations are real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no use; Harald can see nothing. The Vikings, transfi by the sight of their fabled home of the Gods, rise to th feet. Aud whispers to Erik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second note to wake the Gods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik kneels in front of the Horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik blows... a soft gentle note... He takes his mouth aw and smiles at Aud. Once again the Horn stars to vibrate a the note gets louder... the ship starts to vibrate... lou and louder... The whole landscape starts to vibrate... louder and loude grows the note until even the stars in the sky are vibrat and then a magical thing starts to happen... The note fad as one by one the shimmering stars start to fall out of t night sky... they fall like silver snow... until the ship the Vikings... Asgaard... the whole landscape is covered sparkling dust... then in the ensuing silence the first l begins to glow in the Halls of Asgaard... then another... and another... Erik stares as is bewitched and slowly beg to climb out of Golden Dragon.... but Aud tries to pull h back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik! You've done what you came to  do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aud looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow the third note! The note to  take us home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something I must ask the  Gods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No living man has ever set foot in  the Halls of Asgaard... The Gods  will never let you return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik looks at her... for a moment... But he knows he has choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to find my grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I shall come too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at her) No... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to live WITHOUT you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Aud... I... I came to find  someone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aud is about to say "Her?", but she bites the word back a looks down at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Aud... I really am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aud kisses Erik, who then turns and climbs out of Golden  Dragon and sets off across the ice. Sven follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for me! I'll be dead soon  anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go without me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They follow. Even Harald Missionary starts to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they all going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... There's nothing for ME to be  afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harald smiles and sets off after the others. Aud follows. The stars have fallen to form a shining, winding pathway to the City of the Gods. This is what the Vikings head fo Between them and the Citadel strange huge forms rise up. Vikings approach and find the vast skeletons of the slain giants. The Vikings are but tiny gnat-sized figures wendi their way between the vast figures. They climb the stairway-path of stars, up the winding roa and eventually fins themselves outside the massive doors Asgaard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valhalla...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven turns on Harald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! It's real! It's solid! Now do  you believe us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pats the wall of Valhalla -- the Great Hall. Harald re out, but his hand goes right through the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harald Missionary walks straight through the wall and  disappears from sight. The Vikings gasp, and run up to fe the point where he disappeared. The door is perfectly sol to them, and they jump pout of their skins as Harald sudd reappears again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're having me on, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Valhalla -- where the warriors  slain in battle go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't exist for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just s cynic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this moment there is a creak and the great doors  mysteriously swing open. As if mesmerized, the Vikings en the Halls of Asgaard. The door slams behind them. They sp round, but the doors have vanished... No man has ever ent the Halls of Asgaard and left alive... Erik slowly starts to cross the vast floor looking around him as he does so. One by one the other Vikings follow. A a while Erik stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings listen. They hear the sound of children laugh and shouting. Erik and his men follow through the columns towards a pool of light. The scene that greets their eyes not at all what they had been prepared for. Valhalla is not full of the warriors slain in battle, qua mead on the ale-bench and reliving old battles -- it is,  instead full of children romping, laughing, shouting,  quarreling and playing games... chess, fencing... dice... tag, etc., around a wide hearth fire. Women are cooking a doing other housewifely things... weaving, making bread,  etc. It is a thoroughly domestic scene. Suddenly one of t turns at Erik. It is Helga, whom Erik accidentally killed Scene One. She is once again kneading dough. She has a re stain under her breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good! It's Mr. Wonderful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik leaps to her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've come to take you back to the  land of the living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a stupid idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mortally hurt) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the point of being dead in  the land of the living?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ask the Gods to give you life  again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helga looks at Erik very skeptically. She obviously think he doesn't know what he's talking about. Aud reacts. Erik takes Helga's hand -- and gets covered in dough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you tried to ask the God for  anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he talking to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the children, throwing pennies against the wall, l round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings are recovering from their surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting back to her  kneading) He's busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is THAT Odin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to wait till he's finished  his game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting across) Odin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odin leaves his game and saunters towards Erik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have come from the world of  Midgard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child whom Odin is playing with points his hammer at ground near Erik and a lightning bolt zaps into it. Erik  jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait, Thor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't HAVE to help anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenrir the Wolf covers the sun --  men fight and kill each other the  whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should WE care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... you're... you're the  Gods....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the Age of Ragnarok to an end  and stop all this fighting and  bloodshed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harald looks around at the Vikings in increasing desperat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other Child-Gods have stopped playing around now and watching Erik and Odin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik the Viking! The things you seek  are not in our power. We don't make  men love each other or hate each  other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're the Gods!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... Erik...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odin whistles. The other children look over their shoulde From out of the darkness of the perimeter of the Hall, sh emerge... shadows that, as they shuffle and stumble into light, reveal themselves to be the heroes that the Viking had expected to find in Valhalla. But they are not hale a hearty giants quaffing mead and reliving their great  battles... they are, in fact, a sorry lot... the slain-in battle still bearing the hideous deformities of their fat wounds. Most have a sword or an axe buried in some part o their anatomy. One has been cleft in twain... The Vikings react to this grisly gathering as more and mo of them emerge from the shadows. They gasp as they notice Snorri, Ivar, Thorfinn, Loki and Leif the Lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snorri! Ivar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are standing on a bare  mountain top talking to thin air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We notice that Harald's cloak is being blown about as if were indeed on a bare mountain top. The other's cloaks ar still. Sven's dad is gazing across at one horribly mutila specimen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelievingly) How can you tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never forget him! The BASTARD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven reacts. Sven's dad starts to go berserk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drove me mad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his "you'll never be a Berserk  if you lose your temper"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you! I hate you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven's dad collapses against Sven and Sven comforts him,  understandingly. A figure emerges from the throng of dead It is Thorfinn. Sven looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won, Sven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What right have YOU to try and stop  men fighting, Erik the Viking? There  is glory in battle. There are riches  to be made and won...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made by YOU, Loki!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By YOU -- Keitel Blacksmith! Don't  you know, Erik, that is why he went  with you? Ragnarok was good for his  business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my business any more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there is a howl... a bitter howl that echoes abo and around the Halls of Asgaard and that gets more distan and more distant. Everyone (including the dead heroes and the Gods) freezes and looks up, listening. Perhaps we cut away to the boiling sky as it resolves itself into the sh of a wolf that snarls and slinks away. Odin turns to Erik the howling recedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fenrir the Wolf has gone, Erik. But  will men cease fighting each other?  THAT is not in our power...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odin starts to laugh. All the other children start to lau so do the dead heroes. Erik and his men look round uneasi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have one more request before we  return...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik turns towards Helga, who is still standing at her tr of dough with her arms up to her elbows in flour. Aud wat Erik with sadness in her heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return? You have set your foot in  the Halls of Asgaard, Erik. You cannot  return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aud looks round to see how the others react. It is as she had feared. Erik pales. The blood drains from the other's faces. Aud whispers something to Harald. Harald looks at blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) PLEASE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're all imagining this...  whatever it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (earnestly) You're the only one who can. PLEASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harald look around at the dumbfounded Vikings. Then he sh and wanders off, disappearing through the closed doors of Valhalla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean... we must stay here forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he says this Erik's eyes turn again towards Helga. He clearly thinking at least there are compensations... Odin however, is laughing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay HERE? Ha ha! This is Valhalla.  This is reserved for those slain-in- battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning cheerfully) Yeah! We're the LUCKY ones!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's much better than dying of  old age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ghastly and dismembered dead warriors all chortle no at the dismay written on the face of Erik and his men. At the same time there is a grinding, wincing sound. All tho around the hearth-place fall back as a vast grating is wi up from out of the flames. The Vikings look at each other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For YOU there is only the Pit of  Hel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Odin says this there is a roaring sound and the flames and smoke are suddenly reversed and as the roaring increa the flames are sucked down altogether to reveal the black Pit of Hel itself. And now the Pit is sucking the Vikings into it... their hair blows... they try to withstand the  force that is drawing them towards the abyss... The Gods  look on in some amusement. But some of the dead are conce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son! My son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lost!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! Grandfather!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven tries to reconcile his father and grandfather, but i no use. He is sucked towards the Pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Helga) I tried to save you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! I just did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik can no longer withstand the force that is sucking hi down to the Pit of Hel. Suddenly, however, Snorri has lea from the ranks of the dead. He grabs Erik and tries to st him sliding towards the Pit of Hel. But it's no good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Let go, Snorri!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be sucked down too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Arrgh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Ivar and Thorfinn and Leif the Lucky have also leapt forward to save their comrades. They put up a fanta struggle but remorselessly they are all sucked down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aagh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vikings clutch at the stone floor, their fingers trac blood as they try to cling on... but to no avail. The fir are already toppling into the Pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the rest -- including Aud -- soon follow. The mouth of the Pit of Hel, through which the Vikings ar now tumbling higgledy-piggledy, is a round white disc set the unutterable blackness of the pit. However, as the Vik free-fall slowly towards camera, they are lit up by a fai reddish glow from below. They are staring, wild-eyed and  screaming as they fall. As they fall, Erik manages to sma his axe into the side of the Pit. Thorfinn grabs his leg holds onto Sven's foot. Leif clutches at Sven's belt. Sve dad hangs onto Sven's foot. Ivar clutches Thorfinn's foot Erik clutches Ivar's leg and Aud clutches Erik's. They da like this for some seconds, and look fearfully beneath th Then they can see the Infernal Regions of flame and molte lava... somehow suggesting the face of a huge and siniste creature. No wonder they're scared out of their wits. Meanwhile, Odin and Thor appear at the top of the Pit and look down with mild amusement. Thor casually points his h and a streak of lightning zaps Erik's axe. It instantly g red hot. Erik screams. Suddenly we hear a new sound -- a  long, high, sweet note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen! LISTEN! The third note!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's no good. Erik has to let go of the red-hot axe.  Everyone screams as they start to plunge down towards the Pit of Hel.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDEN DRAGON
dialogues.text: Harald Missionary is blowing the Horn Resounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) I want to go home... Oooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Golden Dragon, the Horn Resounding and Harald  Missionary shoot up into the air and disappear from sight

dialogues.speaker: THE PIT OF HEL
dialogues.text: The Vikings are looking down as they fall -- they are sti scared but gradually start laughing... laughing as they f down and down and down until they fall out of sight. We a left with a blackness and just the white disc of the mout of the Pit of Hel above, until the disc changes magically into the moon. There is a series of splashes. The note begins to fade and the camera slowly pans down t reveal the Vikings all fallen into the duck pond back at  Ravensfjord. They are laughing and whooping and splashing each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it... Ha ha ha! It  brought us HOME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But who BLEW it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Who cares? We're HOME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mum! Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sven embraces his father and dances him around with joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo hoo! We're here! We're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the joy drains from their faces and they each ga in horror. What is it they see? We cut to see that out of the huts the women and children and old men are emerging -- but they are anything but hap In fact they are all bound and gagged. Behind them emerge the sinister figures of Halfdan the Black, Gisli and mayb half a dozen armed men. Halfdan and his cronies no longer look sleek and self-assured. They are haggard and despera Their faces are streaked with dirt and sweat, and their  clothes are torn and soiled. They have clearly been going through a lean time, since Ragnarok ended, and have desce on the village for revenge and for whatever plunder they find. They have a few sackfuls of booty with them. They h the women, children and old men into a pathetic huddle in the middle of the village. Halfdan is spitting evil and  hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw down your weapons -- or we  shoot the children first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik hesitates... The others look at him. What choice hav they? Reluctantly, Erik throws his weapons into the pond. The others follow suit. Halfdan watches. His men stand ar him in a tight group with their backs to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... Good... Right, now we'll  just shoot the children anyway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erik is paralyzed. What can they do? Half Halfdan's men a aiming their crossbows at Erik and his comrades, and half are aiming at the women and children. They raise the cros to shoot. Their fingers tighten on the triggers. Suddenly there is a scream from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out below!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks up and, amazingly, out of the sky falls Go Dragon and lands fair and square on top of Halfdan and hi gang, squashing them flat. Harald Missionary staggers ble from the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harald!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes to Harald, while the Vikings rush to release t loved ones. Great celebrations all round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn and see the sun rising. The villagers gasp wonder. They've never seen the sun before. Erik looks aro and sees Thorfinn and Sven with their arms round each oth Aud looks up as Erik smiles at he and holds her to him. T they all turn and gaze at the spectacle of the sun return to the world.
